posts.title: Jesien
posts.excerpt: Not to be confused with the Borowczyk short of the same title, Zbigniew Szymanski’s film documents a day in the life of a worker. An exquisitely beautiful fusion of graphic and photographic imagery, similar in style to the great Jerzy Kucia’s films.

posts.title: Pour rire!
posts.excerpt: Alice is a successful barrister who lives with her stay-at-home boyfriend Nicholas. When their mutual friend Juliette splits up with her partner Michel, Nicholas takes solace in the fact that his relationship with Alice is a stable one. He does not realise that Alice has been seeing another man, a handsome sports photographer, Gaspard, for …

posts.title: High Sierra
posts.excerpt: Roy ‘Mad Dog’ Earle is broken out of prison by an old associate who wants him to help with an upcoming robbery. When the robbery goes wrong and a man is shot and killed Earle is forced to go on the run, and with the police and an angry press hot on his tail he …

posts._title: Jacques Deray – Le marginal AKA The Outsider (1983)
posts.title: Le marginal
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:Fed-up with the inefficiency of the Marseille police, Paris sends drug-enforcement specialist Philippe Jordan to Marseille. He’s supposed to assist the local law enforcement dismantle the drug networks, especially mobster Sauveur Mecacci’s network. So far, Mecacci has managed to elude capture or successful prosecution by local authorities. However, Inspector Philippe Jordan’s unorthodox law enforcement style …

posts.title: Tommaso (2019)
posts.excerpt: Playing opposite the director’s own wife and daughter, Willem Dafoe is a Ferrara-like American artist living in Rome in this improvised drama of doubt and disconnection, shot in self-reflective documentary style.

posts._title: Sergio Da Costa & Maya Kosa – L’Île aux oiseaux AKA Bird Island (2019)
posts.title: L’Île aux oiseaux
posts.excerpt: Birds’ Island? A small veterinary centre specialized in ornithology. Social services have assigned Antonin this job with the aim of re-inserting him into the work-force after illness and isolation, leaving him both unskilled and lacking motivation. He’ll be taking over for Paul, who will soon be leaving for retirement after years of raising mice to …

posts._title: Michael Verhoeven – Wer im Glashaus liebt… AKA He Who Loves in a Glass House (1971)
posts.title: Wer im Glashaus liebt…
posts.excerpt: Michael Verhoeven shot the film on 16mm in the Vienna studio of painter Hundertwasser, for the first time with his wife Senta Berger as an actress. Due to “Indecent Exposure” Verhoeven and his main actor were imprisoned for three days. The film was temporarily confiscated for its obscenity.
posts.titleEnglish: He Who Loves in a Glass House

posts._title: Volker Schaner – Lee Scratch Perry’s Vision of Paradise (2015)
posts.title: Lee Scratch Perry’s Vision of Paradise
posts.excerpt: Quote:A thrilling, poetic narration with the legendary Lee Scratch Perry, this movie is a unique project in many ways: it’s not a biography but rather a fairytale documentary! The director followed Lee Perry for 15 years and discovered a story that is almost impossible to believe: a revelation, told about and with one of the …

posts._title: Jean-Pierre Mocky – Y a-t-il un Français dans la salle? AKA Is There a Frenchman in the House? (1982)
posts.title: Y a-t-il un Français dans la salle?
posts.excerpt: Plot: Based on a novel by Frederic Dard who also co-scripted with director Jean-Pierre Mocky, this satire on French politics is centered around an official whose earlier rise to power had some sordid aspects that are about to be uncovered by the death of his uncle. While he is trying to contain any potential scandal, …
posts.titleEnglish: Is There a Frenchman in the House?

posts._title: Jörg Buttgereit – Der Todesking AKA The Death King (1990)
posts.title: Der Todesking
posts.excerpt: Quote:Seven episodes, each taking place on a different day of the week, on the theme of suicide and violent death.
